thread.title: Portal to the heavens? Rare moment breathtaking 'FIRE RAINBOW' appears in the sky
thread.title_full: Portal to the heavens? Rare moment breathtaking 'FIRE RAINBOW' appears in the sky

title: Portal to the heavens? Rare moment breathtaking 'FIRE RAINBOW' appears in the sky
text: 1 of 11 The photographer creates what he describes as a rainbow of stars This was totally something amazing. It was quite bright. Someone said it looks like a UFO, too Bernard Ong The 23-year-old said: "I was walking towards my bus stop when I found myself in awe of this beautiful cloud and the myriad of colours that were bursting out of it. "This was the most beautiful thing I've ever seen, and I literally turned on Facebook Live to share the exact moment that I saw it. "I was feeling pretty down over the past week, but this immediately lifted my spirits." VIRAL PRESS The 'fire rainbow' stunned onlookers in North-East District, Singapore Fire rainbows - also know as circumhorizontal arcs - are a rare occurrence caused by light bursting through cirrus clouds at high altitude. The sunlight is reflected through the tiny drops of moisture into a bright prism of colours. Related articles
